text: FY2010 Supplemental Appropriations Bill
label: HH1

text: -Bill Summary
label: HH1

text: -Funding Table
label: HH1

text: This supplemental appropriations bill provides over $37.47 billion to support our troops, conduct
label: TITLE

text: the war in Afghanistan, continue to drawdown troops in Iraq, and provide non-military
label: BODY

text: assistance and build up State Department operations in Iraq, Afghanistan, and Pakistan.
label: BODY

text: It also provides over $24 billion to keep teachers, firefighters and law enforcement personnel on
label: BODY

text: the job while states continue to recover from the recession; over $13 billion for Vietnam
label: BODY

text: veterans and survivors exposed to Agent Orange; $5.7 billion for PELL; $2.8 billion for Haiti;
label: BODY

text: $677 million, fully offset, for border security; $275 million for the Gulf Coast oil spill; and $725
label: BODY

text: million, fully offset, for other needs.
label: BODY

text: WAR
label: HH1

text: The bill fully funds the Administration’s war supplemental request of $37.476 billion, of which
label: BODY

text: $33 billion is for Defense and Military Construction and $4.46 billion is for State and Foreign
label: BODY

text: Assistance.  This is in addition to the $130 billion provided in the FY 2010 appropriations bills.
label: BODY

text: Department of Defense and Intelligence Activities in Iraq and Afghanistan:
label: HH1

text: FY2010 Supplemental Appropriations Bill
label: HH1

text: Ongoing Military Operations
label: HH1

text: -  $20.4 billion for operations and maintenance, including the costs of the additional 30,000
label: BODY

text: troops ordered to Afghanistan; $3.4 billion, $500 million above the request for increased fuel
label: BODY

text: costs; and $1.6 billion, $614 million above the request, for the Working Capital Funds to reset
label: BODY

text: prepositioned equipment and meet other Defense logistics needs.
label: BODY

text: -  $2.5 billion for military personnel, $600 million above the request due to better than
label: BODY

text: projected recruiting and retention levels in the Navy, Marine Corps, Air Force, and Marine Corps
label: BODY

text: Reserve and an unanticipated increase in mobilization of Air Force Guardsmen and Reservists.
label: BODY

text: -  $68.4 million for defense health programs, including $35 million above the request for
label: BODY

text: improved operating rooms and equipment.
label: BODY

text: Support for Coalition Partners
label: HH1

text: -  $1 billion to expand and improve capabilities of the Iraq Security Forces, and a new
label: BODY

text: reporting requirement on the intended uses of these funds to ensure they are used for only the
label: BODY

text: most critical needs that Iraq cannot meet itself.
label: BODY

text: -  $2.6 billion to expand and improve capabilities of the Afghan Security Forces.
label: BODY

text: Equipment and Force Structure
label: HH1

text: FY2010 Supplemental Appropriations Bill
label: HH1

text: -  $5.2 billion for procurement, $792 million above the request to replace combat loss
label: BODY

text: equipment ($420 million), for Marine Corps trucks ($176 million), and Guard and Reserve
label: BODY

text: equipment ($200 million).
label: BODY

text: -  $400 million to confront the threat of improvised explosive devices.
label: BODY

text: -  $390 million for research and development, $113 million above the request, including
label: BODY

text: $180 million to develop and test force protection improvements to the Stryker combat vehicle.
label: BODY

text: Military Construction Projects
label: HH1

text: -  $529 million for military construction projects, including $16.5 million, fully offset, for the
label: BODY

text: replacement of the Soldier Readiness Processing Center at Fort Hood, Texas, the site of the
label: BODY

text: 2009 shooting.
label: BODY

text: Department of State and USAID, International Affairs and Stabilization Activities:
label: HH1

text: Assistance and Operations in Afghanistan, Pakistan, and Iraq
label: HH1

text: -  $1.58 billion, $224 million below the request, for Diplomatic and Consular Programs in
label: BODY

text: Afghanistan, Pakistan and Iraq. The bulk of the funding changes from the request are for Iraq
label: BODY

text: where $887 million is provided for overseas protective operations, $305 million above the
label: BODY

text: request, and no funding is included for construction of two permanent consulates ($527 million
label: BODY

text: was requested).
label: BODY

text: FY2010 Supplemental Appropriations Bill
label: HH1

text: -  $7 million, not requested, for the USAID Office of the Inspector General in Pakistan and
label: BODY

text: Afghanistan.
label: BODY

text: -  $1.4 billion, $411 million below the request, for Economic Support to Afghanistan and
label: BODY

text: Pakistan: $1.17 billion for Afghanistan, $408 million below the request, due to likely slower
label: BODY

text: spending than anticipated in the request; and $241 million for Pakistan, $3 million below the
label: BODY

text: request.  Not less than $25 million must go toward human rights programs in Pakistan, including
label: BODY

text: training of security forces in human rights and due process.
label: BODY

text: Other International Assistance
label: HH1

text: -  $200 million, not requested, for Mexico Merida counter-narcotics assistance, of which not
label: BODY

text: less than $100 million is for judicial, anti-corruption and rule of law activities.
label: BODY

text: -  $100 million, not requested, for Economic Support: $90 million for Jordan and $10 million
label: BODY

text: for El Salvador.
label: BODY

text: -  $60 million, not requested, for Foreign Military Financing assistance for Jordan.
label: BODY

text: Other Provisions:
label: HH1

text: -  Afghanistan & Pakistan Performance Assessments: The bill includes language,
label: BODY

text: contained originally in the 2009 Supplemental Appropriations Bill requiring two reports: one on
label: BODY

text: Afghanistan and Pakistan commitment and capabilities, including a new assessment of any
label: BODY

text: actions that could undermine the success of the mission (due with the 2012 budget request)
label: BODY

text: and the other on progress in Afghanistan and Pakistan.
label: BODY

text: -  No Permanent Bases: The bill prohibits funds to establish a permanent base in
label: BODY

text: Afghanistan or Iraq.
label: BODY

text: FY2010 Supplemental Appropriations Bill
label: HH1

text: -  Human Rights: The bill prohibits funds to support any training program if the Secretary of
label: BODY

text: Defense has received credible information that the unit to be trained has committed a gross
label: BODY

text: violation of human rights, unless all necessary corrective steps have been taken. The bill
label: BODY

text: prohibits funds for activities contravening laws or regulations to implement the UN Convention
label: BODY

text: Against Torture or Other Cruel, Inhuman or Degrading Treatment or Punishment.
label: BODY

text: -  Afghanistan Cooperation: The bill provides only $50 million in direct budget support to
label: BODY

text: the government of Afghanistan until the Secretary of State certifies that the government is fully
label: BODY

text: cooperating with the United States.
label: BODY

text: -  Guantanamo Bay: The bill continues the prohibition on the Administration transferring
label: BODY

text: Guantanamo detainees to the United States, other than for the purposes of prosecution and
label: BODY

text: only after a security threat assessment has been provided to the Congress and the Governor of
label: BODY

text: the receiving state.
label: BODY

text: JOBS
label: HH1

text: The bill provides $24.679 billion for education jobs, police jobs and firefighter jobs, and $5.667
label: BODY

text: billion to meet the current shortfall in the Pell Grant Program:
label: BODY

text: -  $23 billion for an Education Jobs Fund to provide additional emergency support to local
label: BODY

text: school districts to prevent impending layoffs.  Without this funding, it is estimated that as many
label: BODY

text: as 300,000 elementary and secondary teachers will be laid off in the coming year.
label: BODY

text: -  $1.179 billion to retain or hire an estimated 5,525 law enforcement officers for three years.
label: BODY

text: -  $500 million to staff local fire companies and retain local firefighters.
label: BODY

text: -  $5.667 billion to meet the current year shortfall in the Pell Grant Program that was
label: BODY

text: unanticipated last year.  Over 8 million students received Pell grants this year.
label: BODY

text: FY2010 Supplemental Appropriations Bill
label: HH1

text: VETERANS, HAITI, OIL SPILL, BORDER AND OTHER MATTERS
label: HH1

text: Veterans: $13.377 billion in mandatory appropriations for the payment of benefits to Vietnam
label: HH1

text: veterans and survivors for exposure to Agent Orange, which has been linked with Parkinson’s
label: BODY

text: disease, ischemic heart disease, and hairy cell/B cell leukemia. An estimated 86,069 people will
label: BODY

text: be eligible to receive retroactive payments and 67,259 people will be eligible to receive new
label: BODY

text: benefits.
label: BODY

text: Haiti: $2.8 billion, $690,000 below the request, for Haiti, including:
label: HH1

text: -  $150 million in Food for Peace Grants.
label: BODY

text: -  $655 million for reimbursement to the Department of Defense, $60 million for
label: BODY

text: reimbursement to the Department of Homeland Security and $220 million for reimbursement to
label: BODY

text: the Department of Health for health and social services response activities.
label: BODY

text: -  $1.7 billion to the Department of State, including:
label: BODY

text: 1. $749 million for Economic Support for recovery, rehabilitation and reconstruction for Haiti.
label: BODY

text: 2. $212 million for Haiti debt relief.
label: BODY

text: 3. $143.5 million for narcotics control and law enforcement programs.
label: BODY

text: 4. $65 million for Diplomatic and Consular Programs.
label: BODY

text: 5. $84.5 million for housing existing diplomatic and development personnel.
label: BODY

text: 6. $96.5 million for the US contribution to the UN Peacekeeping Mission.
label: BODY

text: 7. $5 million for international broadcasting operations.
label: BODY

text: 8. $1.5 million for the USAID Office of the Inspector General.
label: BODY

text: 9. $7.1 million for technical assistance to be provided by the Department of Treasury.
label: BODY

text: 10. $351 million to reimburse International Disaster Assistance.
label: BODY

text: FY2010 Supplemental Appropriations Bill
label: HH1

text: Gulf Oil Spill:  $224 million for the Gulf Coast oil spill. This includes: $83 million for
label: HH1

text: unemployment assistance related to the oil spill and an oil spill relief employment program;
label: BODY

text: allowance for the Coast Guard to receive advances from the Oil Spill Liability Trust fund; $7
label: BODY

text: million for NOAA oil spill response activities, including scientific investigations and sampling;
label: BODY

text: $14 million to respond to economic impacts on fishermen; $10 million for Justice legal activities;
label: BODY

text: $5 million for economic recovery planning; and $31 million for the Department of the Interior to
label: BODY

text: conduct additional inspections and enforcement and to strengthen oversight and regulation and
label: BODY

text: for the EPA to conduct a long-term risk study.
label: BODY

text: NOTE: All costs directly related to the Gulf Coast oil spill must be reimbursed by the
label: HH1

text: responsible parties.
label: BODY

text: Border Security: $677 million, fully offset, to strengthen enforcement on the southern border,
label: HH1

text: including:
label: BODY

text: -  $208.4 million for 1,200 additional Border Patrol agents deployed between the ports of
label: BODY

text: entry along the Southwest Border.
label: BODY

text: -  $136 million to maintain current Customs and Border Protection (CBP) officer staffing
label: BODY

text: levels and add 500 additional officers at ports of entry along the Southwest Border.
label: BODY

text: -  $67.5 million for improved tactical communications on the Southwest Border, three
label: BODY

text: permanent Border Patrol forward operating bases, and a surge of workforce integrity
label: BODY

text: investigations designed to prevent corruption among the CBP officers and agents.
label: BODY

text: -  $50 million for Operation Stonegarden grants to support local law enforcement activities
label: BODY

text: on the border.
label: BODY

text: -  $30 million for Immigration and Customs Enforcement activities directed at reducing the
label: BODY

text: threat of narcotics smuggling and associated violence.
label: BODY

text: -  $177 million may be used to deploy National Guard troops to the southern border should
label: BODY

text: the President decide to do so.
label: BODY

text: FY2010 Supplemental Appropriations Bill
label: HH1

text: Other Security and Urgent Needs:
label: HH1

text: The following additional items are all fully offset:
label: BODY

text: USDA Rural Loans: $172.8 million for the USDA Section 502 guaranteed single family loan
label: BODY

text: program, supporting $12 billion in loans.  This program ran out of money the second week of
label: BODY

text: May due to extraordinarily high demand because of the tight credit market.
label: BODY

text: Energy Loans: $180 million to allow $18 billion in innovative technology energy loans, split
label: HH1

text: evenly between nuclear and renewable energy programs.
label: BODY

text: Emergency Food Assistance: $50 million for The Emergency Food Assistance Program for
label: HH1

text: food purchases to distribute through local emergency food providers.
label: BODY

text: Financial Crisis Inquiry Commission: $2.7 million to allow the Commission to investigate the
label: HH1

text: causes of the recent financial crisis.  The Commission is tasked with submitting its report by
label: BODY

text: December, 2011.
label: BODY

text: Coast Guard: $58.5 million for the rehabilitation of Coast Guard aircraft.
label: HH1

text: Mine Safety: $48 million to reverse the growing backlog of mine safety enforcement cases
label: HH1

text: while ensuring that the Mine Safety and Health Administration (MSHA) can complete 100% of
label: BODY

text: its mandated mine inspections.  The funds will also allow improved MSHA emergency response
label: BODY

text: operations through the purchase and upgrade of emergency response equipment; and testing
label: BODY

text: FY2010 Supplemental Appropriations Bill
label: HH1

text: and research by the National Institute for Occupational Safety and Health (NIOSH) on the most
label: BODY

text: common refuge chambers currently required in all underground mines and on other refuge
label: BODY

text: alternatives.
label: BODY

text: Capitol Police: $15.9 million, as requested, for the ongoing acquisition and installation of a
label: HH1

text: modern digital radio system because of known security threats.
label: BODY

text: Port of Guam: $50 million, as requested, to improve, and provide greater access to, port
label: HH1

text: facilities.
label: BODY

text: Recovery Act Audits: $20 million for the Government Accountability Office (GAO), to continue
label: HH1

text: to audit and review the use of Recovery Act funding to prevent waste, fraud, and abuse.
label: BODY

text: Farm Loans: $27 million to support an increase in loan authority of almost $850,000,000 for the
label: HH1

text: Farm Service Agency (FSA) to provide direct loans to family farmers who may not qualify for
label: BODY

text: agricultural credit through other commercial institutions in the tight credit market.  The funding
label: BODY

text: provided in the FY 2010 appropriation bill was estimated to meet demand at the time the bill
label: BODY

text: was passed, but demand for the farm ownership and operating loan programs continues to rise
label: BODY

text: above historical levels due to the lack of availability of conventional credit. The increase is fully
label: BODY

text: offset by rescissions of Farm Service Agency appropriations from 2004 through 2007 that are
label: BODY

text: no longer needed.
label: BODY

text: Disaster Assistance: $100 million in Community Development Block Grant (CDBG) funding to
label: HH1

text: help local communities devastated by natural disasters this year.
label: BODY

text: Offsets:
label: HH1

text: The following rescissions of funds, from programs that no longer require such funds for the
label: BODY

text: purposes originally appropriated, offset the items above:
label: BODY

text: -  $69.9 million in funds appropriated in 2007 and before to the Department of Agriculture.
label: BODY

text: FY2010 Supplemental Appropriations Bill
label: HH1

text: -  $2.7 million in funds appropriated in 2010 to the Judiciary.
label: BODY

text: -  $36 million in funds appropriated in 2006 to FEMA.
label: BODY

text: -  $7 million in funds appropriated in 2006 to the Coast Guard.
label: BODY

text: -  $3.8 million in funds appropriated in 2007 for research in DHS’ Domestic Nuclear
label: BODY

text: Detection office.
label: BODY

text: -  $6.6 million in funds appropriated in 2007 to the Transportation Security Administration.
label: BODY

text: -  $6 million in funds appropriated in 1995 to HHS.
label: BODY

text: -  $11 million in funds appropriated in 1989 to the Federal Highway Administration.
label: BODY

text: -  $8 million in funds appropriated in 2004 and 2006 to the Federal Aviation Administration.
label: BODY

text: -  $311 million in funds appropriated in 2008 for Ike, Gustav and Midwest Floods.
label: BODY

text: -  $318 million in funds appropriated in 2008 for CDBG for Katrina.
label: BODY

text: -  $15 million in funds appropriated in 2009 for NIST internal construction.
label: BODY

text: -  $47 million in funds appropriated for Army Corps of Engineers projects now terminated or
label: BODY

text: completed.
label: BODY

text: -  $190 million in funds appropriated to the Department of Defense that are the result of bid
label: BODY

text: savings.
label: BODY

text: Other Provisions:
label: HH1

text: Iran Sanctions: The bill prohibits funding from being provided for any new contract unless the
label: BODY

text: contractor has certified that it, and any entities it controls, does not engage in activity that could
label: BODY

text: be sanctioned under section 5 of the Iran Sanctions Act of 1996.
label: BODY

text: No Fly List: The bill requires the Transportation Security Administration (TSA) to require
label: BODY

text: commercial foreign air carriers to check the list of individuals TSA has prohibited from flying no
label: BODY

text: later than 30 minutes after the list has been updated.
label: BODY

text: High-Value Detainee Interrogations: The bill requires the FBI to submit the High-Value
label: BODY

text: Detainee Interrogation procedures, and any updates to those procedures, to the Congress
label: BODY

text: within 30 days.
label: BODY

text: Defense Jobs Estimates: The bill requires an assessment of the number of jobs and costs
label: HH1

text: associated with new major defense acquisitions planned for 2011.
label: BODY

text: FY2010 Supplemental Appropriations Bill
label: HH1
